lessons.lessonText:
First, you will learn about basic rythmic unit, called "mora". 
Mora is a technical term that linguists use to define a phonological unit of a language.

questions.question: Identify the number of mora in the word.

subsections.lessonText: When vocal cord vibrates, voiced sound is generated. For example, "g" is voiced while "k" is a voiceless consonant. It is generally not difficult sound to hear or pronounce. Research has shown that Chinese native speakers would have difficulty with hearing voicless consonant in some conditions.

subsections.lessonText:
Many learners of Japanese find long vowels to be somewhat difficult.
 It changes a meaning of word. Observe following pairs. 
 You can see a vowel "o" is much longer in コート, compared to the one in こと. The tip is to make a vowel sufficiently longer and not to hurry.
